title: Medical Coder 1 Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Tennessee Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Laid back and very relaxed manager is very easy to Talk to and informal. She worked with me due to my long commute and offered my 4 10 hour shifts so I won't have to drive 5 days a week
Interview Questions: Not hard but we did have a coding test at the end

title: Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at West Tennessee Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: good interview and questions.  I learned about the position.  recruiter was nice and helpful.  managers let me shadow on units to see where I fit.  it was good.  trying to get to the 30 word minimum for this review
Interview Questions: tell me about previous experience as a CNA

title: Patient Financial Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at West Tennessee Healthcare (Jackson, TN) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: My hiring process started out a bit stressful. I actually applied for the position maybe 2-3 times before being chosen. Once I was chosen I completed an interview with hr and was told if chosen I would get a call from the department manager for an interview. About a month later I received a call from the department manager to come in for an interview. It went great so I moved on to the second round. I was called that afternoon with the job offer.
Interview Questions: I was asked if I had a problem with sitting for long periods of time.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at West Tennessee Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with HR and then department.  Interview was good and recruiter was nice.  Process took a few weeks.  It helped that I had reference letters and a copy of my education available to turn in.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at West Tennessee Healthcare (Jackson, TN)
Interview Descriptions: 1st, there's a HR recruiter interview; then there's an actual departmental interview. The 2nd interview is at the department's discretion and is not guaranteed. So after the 1st HR interview, you go back online and apply for jobs again. Then if a department is actually interested, you will get a 2nd call. It was confusing to me at 1st.

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at West Tennessee Healthcare (Jackson, TN) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Got the interview then had to do orientation for a few days which is where everyone that got hired that month sits in the same area you do and we all do orientation together then start working
Interview Questions: Don't remember any question they asked me.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at West Tennessee Healthcare (Jackson, TN) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The hospital admitting department head and the Emergency Room head along with two supervisors interviewed me at the same time. 
It was the most exciting interview I have ever had. They had left the door open to the room and a man was spewing blood down the hall. 
The ER boss said. "Well, since you havent left yet this might be the job for you" They all took turns asking me questions 
After they were finished, they all took turns being upfront and honest about the often stressful, emotional, tense and at times dangerous working conditions I would be involved.
Interview Questions: Do you thrive in a fast paced work place

title: Tranporter Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at West Tennessee Healthcare (Jackson, TN) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to be seated. An apology was given to me because the interview started late. They wanted to know why did I want to work for them and why did I choose my course of study at TCAT Whiteville.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work for them?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at West Tennessee Healthcare (Jackson, TN)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was group of managers/staff nurses. Each took turns asking different questions. The process for me was easy because I do well speaking with groups. After the interview I received a call from HR offering me the job.
Interview Questions: Average questions about co-worker issues. To give situations from past experience. Why you think you would be good for the job.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Tennessee Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is notoriously long.  It may take 3-4 weeks before they call you for an interview.   You first have an interview with Human Resources.   If you make it thru that then HR will set up an interview with the manager or director of the area you are applying for.  Then HR will call you hopefully with an offer.

title: Staff Nurse Employee Health Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at West Tennessee Healthcare (Jackson, TN) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview by 3 staff panel.  I was a senior applicant; they went with a younger applicant. Told me that I 'interviewed well and was very qualified but went with different applicant and thought they were a better fit'.  Although tough to prove I really think it was all about the age.
Interview Questions: How do you work with others.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at West Tennessee Healthcare (Jackson, TN) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Round table meeting with the managers. Just a series of questions asked to you. They are mostly trying to get a feel for your personality and how you would fit in with the core group of people there. If you have the interview in mostly looks like the job is almost yours. Just do not say anything even mildly offensive and do not show any tattoos. There is rule through the whole hospital about always having to cover up tattoos so if you have any on your arms wear long sleeves. Do your best to cover them up, after the interview when you come to work you would be required to put a bandage or some other cover over them.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at West Tennessee Healthcare in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Sat down with two department directors who asked interview questions. Laid back environment with discussion questions. Seemed to be feeling me out and deciding where would be the best fit for me. Felt positive after leaving interview.
Interview Questions: Why did you become a nurse?

title: Clinic Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at West Tennessee Healthcare (Canton, MS) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the Director of Clinics, Chief operating Officer & Chief Executive Officer it was great everyone sitting at the conference room table asking questions about my past experiences and work ethics..
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: PTA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at West Tennessee Healthcare in Dec 2010

title: X-RAY Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at West Tennessee Healthcare (Jackson, TN) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very nice people, not rushed. They were very accommodating to my schedule
